intro: Aristida purpurea var. fendleriana, commonly known as purple threeawn, is a perennial grass native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, wiry stems with narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces dense clusters of small, spike-like inflorescences that are usually purple or pink in color, giving it its common name. It is adapted to dry conditions and thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. This species is often found in open habitats such as plains, prairies, and disturbed areas.
